alert.note: Alert for Archuleta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 17 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 700 PM TUESDAY UNTIL 900 AM WEDNESDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...southern Mineral and northern Archuleta Counties. WHEN...700 PM Tuesday May 17 to 900 AM Wednesday May 18 IMPACTS...Periods of moderate to heavy smoke from the Plumtaw wildfire located northwest of Pagosa Springs will impact areas along the Archuleta and Mineral County line through Tuesday evening. Late Tuesday night, smoke will begin to drain towards the Piedra River to the southwest of the fire bringing occasional heavy smoke through early Wednesday morning. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
